features.featureTitle:
In `frontend/src/App.tsx`, replace the current implementation of the component‚Äôs initial in-memory content with the user-provided ‚ÄúNew Code‚Äù values, specifically updating only the default state initializers while keeping all existing save/restore, polling, navigation, and UI wiring intact.

Required default values:
- `landingMessage` default: `"Happy Valentine's Day, Apshara!"`
- `videoSlots` defaults (keep the same remote MP4 URLs, `file: null`, but change headings):
  1) heading: `"ü§≠"`, url: `https://image2url.com/r2/default/videos/1771095915401-63c93159-e8fd-4bbb-b597-ec2f0c851aae.mp4`
  2) heading: `"ü§ê"`, url: `https://image2url.com/r2/default/videos/1771096125343-9f368017-cf72-4a89-a32a-82afbda31671.mp4`
  3) heading: `"Am I in Love with You? Definitely"`, url: `https://image2url.com/r2/default/videos/1771096462549-283a08bb-3e21-4aed-bedc-66811ea1f837.mp4`
- `finalMessage` default: set exactly to the provided multiline text:
  `"Happy Valentine‚Äôs Day, Flora. I‚Äôve been feeling terrible about last night, and I‚Äôm so sorry for how I acted. You deserve to be treated with nothing but love, especially today. I‚Äôm incredibly lucky to have you, and I‚Äôd love to make it up to you and focus on us. I love you\nthis alr?\n"`

Do not change any other user-facing text in the app outside these defaults.

Add brief inline comments in `frontend/src/App.tsx` adjacent to the modified state initializers explaining that these values are the initial defaults used only when no remote/global/local saved state is available, so future refactors do not accidentally treat them as hard-coded overrides.
